NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF EDUCATIONAL BROADCASTERS
OFFICE OF EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR
UNIVERSITY OF ILLINOIS
119 GREGORY HALL
URBANA, ILLINOIS
MEMORANDUM
TO: Becker, Chairman, NAEB Research Committee
Les Greenhill, Chairman, NAEB CCTV Committee
Gale Adkins, Chairman, NAEB Utilization Committee
FROM: Harold E. Hill
DATE: October 7, 1959
Dr* Anna Hyer, Executive Secretary, Department of Audio-Visual Instruction,
National Education Association, has been exploring with the United States
Office of Education the possibility of the Office including certain questions
about utilization of A-V materials in its biennial survey of the status of
education* She has kindly offered to submit questions about radio and
television if we can supply them.
Of course, she is not certain that the USCE will be able to undertake the
addition of questions in our fields, nor that they would accept any or all
of the questions we might propose. However, this seems like an excellent
opportunity to at least try to get soire information about uses of radio and
television in education in the nation* s schools.
Therefore, will you please send me, as soon as convenient, a list of perÂ¬
tinent questions, the answers to which you believe would be helpful to the
NAEB and the entire educational broadcasting movement? The time on this
is short, so I would appreciate anything you can do soon. Thanks.
HEH: JO
